Source Text (English): The children laughed and played under the afternoon sun.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang mga bata ay nagtawanan at naglaro sa ilalim ng hapon na araw.
Rater 1 Explanation: Accurate, fluent, and natural translation. Captures the tone and meaning well.
Rater 2 Explanation: Just slight error due to the literal translation of the "afternoon sun" to "hapon na araw". Afternoon sun means the Sun during the afternoon

Source Text (English): She took a break to gather her thoughts.
Target Text (Filipino): Nagpahinga siya para mag-isip-isip.
Rater 1 Explanation: The translation is accurate. It was able to capture the meaning of the idiom "gather her thoughts", instead of translating it literally to "kumuha ng ideya"
Rater 2 Explanation: The translation would have been better if the translation also captured the gender indicated by the pronoun.

Source Text (English): It's raining cats and dogs.
Target Text (Filipino): Umuulan ng pusa at aso.
Rater 1 Explanation: Literal translation of an idiom, doesn't make sense in Filipino.
Rater 2 Explanation: Fails to capture the idiomatic meaning; sounds nonsensical.

Source Text (English): Thank you for coming to the event.
Target Text (Filipino): Salamat sa pagpunta sa kaganapan.
Rater 1 Explanation: Perfect, natural, and accurate.
Rater 2 Explanation: Excellent, natural, and idiomatic translation.

Source Text (English): That designer bag costs an arm and a leg.
Target Text (Filipino): Napakamahal ng designer bag na 'yan.
Rater 1 Explanation: Accurate, Fluent, Coherent, Complete, and captures the meaning of the idiomatic expression.
Rater 2 Explanation: Complete, and sounds natural. Captures the meaning well.

Source Text (English): Mark accidentally let the cat out of the bag about the surprise trip.
Target Text (Filipino): Hindi sinasadyang nailabas ni Mark ang pusa mula sa maleta tungkol sa surprise trip.
Rater 1 Explanation: Complete, and gramatically correct. However, the idiomatic expression was translated literally which loses the original intent of the sentence.
Rater 2 Explanation: Idiom was not translated correctly

Source Text (English): This would be easier if blood came in more colours.
Target Text (Filipino): Ito ay magiging mas madali kung ang dugo ay dumating sa mas maraming kulay.
Rater 1 Explanation: flawed translation takes "came in more colors" literally

Source Text (English): Stealth is not your thing. But it's adorable you're willing to try.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang pagnanakaw ay hindi bagay sa iyo. Ngunit ito ay kaibig-ibig na handa kang subukan.
Rater 1 Explanation: "sumubok" might be better than "subukan" in this context
Rater 2 Explanation: Changing adorable to "nakakabilib" (impressive) changes the tone for this line. Rouge calling Knuckles "cute" is meant to have immasculating undertones. In the incorrect translation, stealth is refering to the act of being stealthy/quiet/hidden. Pagnanakaw is theft. wrong translation entirely.

Source Text (English): Which of the following tools is LEAST likely to be used in the process of creating a wood sculpture?
Target Text (Filipino): Alin sa mga sumusunod ang PINAKABIHIRANG ginagamit sa paggawa ng eskulturang kahoy?
Rater 1 Explanation: Perfect translation. Sounds natural as well for a native speaker.
Rater 2 Explanation: Accurate translation that would be used in everyday conversations.

Source Text (English): I can't stop smiling when you're there
Target Text (Filipino): Hindi ko mapigilang ngumiti tuwing andiyan ka
Rater 1 Explanation: translation is accurate while sounding natural
Rater 2 Explanation: The translation is correct and still sounds smooth and natural.

Source Text (English): I just want to be your everything.
Target Text (Filipino): Nais ko lang ay maging lahat para sa’yo
Rater 1 Explanation: fairly accurate translation but structure of sentence is quite different from english meaning
Rater 2 Explanation: the meaning is mostly right, but the way the sentence is put together is quite different from the English version.

Source Text (English): If I give you all my life, would you still be mine?
Target Text (Filipino): Kung ibibigay ko sa’yo ang buong buhay ko, akin ka pa rin ba?
Rater 1 Explanation: "sa akin" would be the most proper translation but the overall translation is quite accurate
Rater 2 Explanation: Sa akin' might be a better choice, but overall the translation still gets the meaning across well.

Source Text (English): A stack overflow happens when there is too much memory used on the call stack.
Target Text (Filipino): Nangyayari ang stack overflow kapag labis ang paggamit ng memorya sa call stack.
Rater 1 Explanation: gramatically correct and serves the original meaning well, using "labis" makes it feel more formal compared to alternatives (eg, "sobrang" in this context)
Rater 2 Explanation: Too literal; lacks clarification of technical terms.

Source Text (English): The database index speeds up data retrieval by reducing the number of disk accesses.
Target Text (Filipino): Pinapabilis ng database index ang pagkuha ng data sa pamamagitan ng pagbawas sa pag-access sa disk.
Rater 1 Explanation: the phrase "pagkuha ng data" could be rewritten to "pagkuha ng impormasyon", and the overall phrasing is awkward
Rater 2 Explanation: Awkward phrasing; “pag-access sa disk” sounds unnatural.

Source Text (English): The kernel handles low-level operations in the operating system.
Target Text (Filipino): Pinangangasiwaan ng kernel ang mga low-level na operasyon sa operating system.
Rater 1 Explanation: A lot of English terms are retained, which is somewhat acceptable in tech-related Filipino, but results in many borrowed terms. "low-level" could probably be translated though.
Rater 2 Explanation: Poor localization; relies too much on untranslated English.

Source Text (English): The address bus carries memory addresses to the CPU.
Target Text (Filipino): Dinadala ng address bus ang mga memory address papunta sa CPU.
Rater 1 Explanation: straightforward and generally accurate, tech-based Filipino terms/translations could be argued (eg, "memory address" as "address ng memorya")
Rater 2 Explanation: Word-for-word; no effort to adapt terms.

Source Text (English): Jollibee is a famous fast food restaurant in the Philippines.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang Jollibee ay isang sikat na kainan sa Pilipinas.
Rater 1 Explanation: Better to phrase it as “Ang Jollibee ay isa sa mga sikat na kainan sa Pilipinas”
Rater 2 Explanation:
- accurate translation
- good grammar

Source Text (English): Filipinos visit their relatives during holidays.
Target Text (Filipino): Tuwing bakasyon, binibisita ng mga Pilipino ang kani-kanilang mga pamilya
Rater 1 Explanation: Better to use and phrase it as “Tuwing bakasyon, binibisita ng mga Filipino ang kani-kanilang mga mahal sa buhay.” Filipino not Pilipino, and also best to use mahal sa buhay for a more deeper and authentic translation rather than using the direct translation of family (pamilya).
Rater 2 Explanation: #NAME?

Source Text (English): Filipinos often use the expression "po" and "opo" as a sign of respect to elders.
Target Text (Filipino): Ginagamit ng mga Pilipino ang mga salitang “po” at “opo” bilang paggalang sa mga nakakatanda.
Rater 1 Explanation: Filipino not Pilipino. Change and take note of this.
Rater 2 Explanation: #NAME?

Source Text (English): Adobo is one of the most popular dishes in the Philippines, made with soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang Adobo ay isa sa mga pinakasikat na ulam sa Pilipinas at ito ay gawa sa toyo, suka, at bawang.
Rater 1 Explanation: Perfect translation.
Rater 2 Explanation:
- not sure if “sa” in “gawa sa” is the right word?? but if it’s conversational it’s fine
- kung formal i’d probably say “gawa gamit ang”

Source Text (English): The hospitability of Filipinos are known worldwide
Target Text (Filipino): Ang pagiging hospitable ng mga Pilipino ay kilala sa buong mundo
Rater 1 Explanation: kilala could be replaced with alam which would make it sound more natural.
Rater 2 Explanation: kilala could be replace with sikat

Source Text (English): We love to celebrate fiestas and gatherings with family and friends
Target Text (Filipino): Mahal natin ang pagdidiwang ng piyesta and salo-salo kasama ang pamilya at mga kaibigan
Rater 1 Explanation: doesnt sound natural, could be better with Mahilig tayo magdiwang ng piyesta at salo-salo kasama ng ating pamilya at mga kaibigan
Rater 2 Explanation: salo-salo could be replaced with pagtitipon for accurate translation

Source Text (English): Adobo and sinigang are just some of the delicious Filipino dishes that are truly craved.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang adobo at sinigang ay ilan lamang sa masasarap na pagkaing Pilipino na talaga naman hinahanap-hanap
Rater 1 Explanation: sounds natural, - is used properly for repeating worlds like hinahanap-hanap
Rater 2 Explanation: accurate translation

Source Text (English): Eating rice with almost every meal is part of out culture
Target Text (Filipino): Bahagi ng ating kultura ang pagkain ng kanin sa halos bawat pagkain
Rater 1 Explanation: doesnt sound natural and can be ambiguous.
Rater 2 Explanation: gramatically correct but doesn't sound natural

Source Text (English): The nurse inserted the IV incorrectly, causing bruising.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang nurse ay pinasok ang IV ng mali, kaya nagka-pasa.
Rater 1 Explanation: translation feels too direct and it ended up having awkward phrasing
Rater 2 Explanation: Direct translation. There could've been a better term.

Source Text (English): The patient was given penicillin to prevent infection.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang pasyente ay binigyan ng penicillin upang maiwasan ang impeksyon.
Rater 1 Explanation: its clear, fluent, formal, and natural, it conveys the clinical intent without making the translation sound forced
Rater 2 Explanation: Correct translation, and it is not awkward to read as it can be comprehended easily.

Source Text (English): To be able to start fasting, you have to stop eating and drinking anything except water at least 8 hours before your test.
Target Text (Filipino): Para makapagsimula ng fasting, tigilan ang pagkain at pag-inom 8 oras bago ang test, tubig lang pwede.
Rater 1 Explanation: "tigilan" is awkward in the context making the phrasing weird and casual, and "pwede" makes the instruction sound optional when it should be strict.
Rater 2 Explanation: The whole sentence sounds awkward, and the number 8 could've been translated into its word form.

Source Text (English): After being checked up, you have to be admitted to the hospital for observation and treatment.
Target Text (Filipino): Pagkatapos ng check-up, kailangang ma-admit ka sa ospital para ma-obserbahan at gamutan.
Rater 1 Explanation: translation became to literal, "ma-admit", "ma-oberserbahan", and "check-up" are mixed Fil-Eng and sound awkward in formal medical writing.
Rater 2 Explanation: The sentence is a bit awkward, especially some parts of the sentence were not translated properly into its corresponding translation (code switching).

Source Text (English): I always make it a priority to set aside time for my hobbies.
Target Text (Filipino): Lagi ko sinisigurado na maglaan ng oras para sa aking mga libangan.
Rater 1 Explanation: translation overall has the same meaning but uses different words like sinisigurado
Rater 2 Explanation: translation of sentence is "I ensure..." rather than "I always prioritize..."

Source Text (English): One of the purposes of life is to help others without expecting anything in return.
Target Text (Filipino): Isa sa layunin ng buhay ay ang tumulong sa kapwa nang walang kapalit
Rater 1 Explanation: translation is natural and meaning is well conveyed
Rater 2 Explanation: correct and natural sounding translation

Source Text (English): I exclusively use Spotify to listen to music such as OPM.
Target Text (Filipino): Sa Spotify lang ako nakikinig ng music katulad ng OPM.
Rater 1 Explanation: decent translation but awkward wording
Rater 2 Explanation: awkard phrasing

Source Text (English): I have a large collection of non-fiction books that's always well-organized and clean.
Target Text (Filipino): Meron akong koleksyon ng mga non-fiction na libro na palagi ko sinisigurado na organisado at malinis.
Rater 1 Explanation: translation is understandable but phrasing and wording can be improved on
Rater 2 Explanation: did not translate "large" and awkward translation of "well-organized"

Source Text (English): Taking crazy things seriously is a serious waste of time.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang pagseseryoso ng mga bagay na baliw ay isang seryosong pag-aaksaya ng oras.
Rater 1 Explanation: Captures tone and meaning well, using native-sounding phrasing without sounding forced or literal.
Rater 2 Explanation: It uses words that flow naturally and matches the tone accurately.

Source Text (English): Things outside you are projections of what’s inside you, and what’s inside you is a projection of what’s outside.
Target Text (Filipino): Ang mga bagay sa labas mo ay salamin ng nasa loob mo, at ang nasa loob mo ay salamin ng nasa labas.
Rater 1 Explanation: Accurate and clear, though some of the poetic impact is slightly reduced.
Rater 2 Explanation: The translation replaces a complex phrase with a simpler metaphor.

Source Text (English): Some men are born mediocre, some men achieve mediocrity, and some men have mediocrity thrust upon them.
Target Text (Filipino): May ilang lalaking ipinanganak na katamtaman, may ilang nakakamit ang pagiging karaniwan, at may ilan na ipinipilit na lamang sa kanila ang pagiging ganoon.
Rater 1 Explanation: It mimics the original text's rhythm until the last part, where it reads too literal.
Rater 2 Explanation: Preserves the structure and meaning well, though katamtaman and ganoon are odd word choices.

Source Text (English): Mother died today. Or maybe yesterday; I can't be sure.
Target Text (Filipino): Sumakabilang-buhay si Inay ngayong araw. O baka kahapon; medyo nalilito na ako.
Rater 1 Explanation: The tone in the translated text feels too colloquial.
Rater 2 Explanation: Doesn't feel natural. Too literal.

Source Text (English): The wave returns to the ocean, where it came from, and where it's supposed to be.
Target Text (Filipino): Bumabalik ang alon sa karagatan, kung saan ito nanggaling, at kung saan ito dapat nasa.
Rater 1 Explanation: The wording feels awkward and unnatural.
Rater 2 Explanation: Extremely unnatural wording, especially on "kung saan ito dapat nasa." Despite that, it still conveys the rough meaning of the original text.

Source Text (English): Sick of tea?! That's like being sick of breathing!
Target Text (Filipino): Ayaw mo na ng tsaa?! Parang sinabi mo na ring sawa ka nang huminga!
Rater 1 Explanation: Wording is natural and uses appropriate that properly conveys the emotion in the sentence.
Rater 2 Explanation: Exceptionally natural translation. Even conveying the emotional surprise and colloquial tone of the original text.

Source Text (English): I wanted to invite my youngest to go get some ice cream, if he’ll let me.
Target Text (Filipino): Gusto ko imbitahin yung pinakabata kong anak para kumuha ng ice cream, kung papayagan niya ako.
Rater 1 Explanation: Not the best translation while its mostly correct its not natural, for more casual contexts yayain is more commonly used, additionally youngest child has a word in tagalog called "bunso" that would be more appropriate here.
Rater 2 Explanation: Although the meaning of the original sentence is there, the delivery is very stinted, especially on its word usage (pinakabata and imbitahin).

Source Text (English): That person has no more respect or love for you, leave them.
Target Text (Filipino): Wala nang respeto at pagmamahal yung tao para sa'yo, iwan mo na.
Rater 1 Explanation: The sentence flows very well and uses more informal words used in conversation like sa'yo.
Rater 2 Explanation: Sounds very natural, capturing the sentiment carried by the original sentence.
